channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cybercriminals are stooping to a new low by targeting job seekers when the market is already bad: ‘Where’s the good sheep for the wolf to go attack?’
item.description: DNSFilter found 8,724 malicious domains containing the word “jobs,” with the overwhelming majority (86%) newly registered or observed.

item.title: Sam Altman sometimes wishes OpenAI were public so haters could short the stock—‘I would love to see them get burned on that’
item.description: Despite reports, Altman said OpenAI has no specific timeline on going public.

item.title: Stock futures climb as investors await Supreme Court showdown on Trump tariffs and shareholder vote on Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
item.description: On Thursday, Tesla shareholders will gather for the company’s annual meeting and will vote on Musk’s $1 trillion compensation package.

item.title: Walmart CEO said paying its star managers upwards of $620,000 yearly empowered them to ‘feel like owners’
item.description: From Rolls-Royce to Volkswagen, companies are betting big on pay hikes to fix culture—because money still talks.

item.title: Ferrari to release crypto token to let wealthy fans take part in 499P auction
item.description: The Italian car maker says the 100 top token owners will be able to bid on the luxury car

item.title: ‘The Witcher’ Season 4 Review: The Good, The Bad And The Rats
item.description: 'The Witcher' returns to Netflix with a new Geralt of Rivia in a mixed fourth season.

item.title: Kentucky Woman Sent Box Of Human Arms, Fingers Instead Of Medications
item.description: A Kentucky woman was expecting a delivery of medications and medical supplies. But when she opened the box, she found four human fingers and two human...

item.title: AI Is Learning To Fight Fires — But Can We Trust It With The Flames?
item.description: Can AI stop the next wildfire before it spreads? New technology aims to fight fires faster than humans ever could.

item.title: Why And How Modern Chip Design Is Automated
item.description: AI-driven semiconductor design eclipses human understanding, reshaping workflows into full-stack, automated, hardware-software “layer-cake” systems.

item.title: Fed president explains vote against interest rate cut
item.description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by 25-basis-points in October, though two policymakers dissented from the move, with one saying that he remains...

item.title: Everything Runs Inside AI Now. Including Your Business.
item.description: Applications no longer contain AI - AI contains applications. When AI platforms decide if customers find you, it fundamentally transforms how your bus...

item.title: Palantir’s stock rises as AI fuels another flurry of earnings records

Dow closes lower, while Big Tech powers S&P 500 and Nasdaq to gains
Family vacations aren’t what they used to be. Here's why.

item.title: Government shutdown blocks key GDP data release – what do the Fed's models say about economic growth?
item.description: The ongoing government shutdown has delayed the official third-quarter GDP report release, although real-time estimates from a pair of Federal Reserve...

item.title: Largest US airlines raise pressure on Dems to 'pass a clean CR' and end shutdown
item.description: Major U.S. airlines are calling on Congress to reopen the government as TSA workers and air traffic controllers are continuing to work without pay.

item.title: BlackRock's Larry Fink says US still top destination for global investors to park money
item.description: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the U.S. will remain the top investment destination as money flows back up into American assets amid the AI surge and th...

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
